title: Post Impressions III
text:
into the strenuous briefness
Life:
handorgans and April
darkness,friends

i charge laughing.
Into the hair-thin tints
of yellow dawn,
into the women-coloured twilight

i smilingly
glide.   I
into the big vermillion departure
swim, sayingly;

(Do you think?)the
i do,world
is probably made
of roses & hello:

(of solongs and,ashes)
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “Tulips and Chimneys”
